technology.name: Hideous Amputation
technology.description: Weapons are an extension of the self. Literally, in some cases, where viscous slime welds weapons to flesh.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +3% per experience rank for all Great Weapons units
Attribute: Cause Fear for all great weapon units (rank 4 and above)

technology.name: Human Trials
technology.description: Endless experiments pave the way for better understanding the putrid magics of decay.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Cloud of Flies" for Aspiring Champions and Chosen of Nurgle units
Passive ability: "Regeneration" for Aspiring Champions units
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Nurgle and Death spells

technology.name: Virulent Blessings
technology.description: Madness and misery open the mind, making space for the gifts of Nurgle's blessing.

effects.description: Maximum active gifts: +1 for Gifts of Nurgle
Army ability: "Rot, Glorious Rot"

ui_effects.description: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

technology.name: Rampant Plaguebearers
technology.description: Nurgle sends His Plaguebearers forth, to spread their noxious maladies throughout the land.

effects.description: Gifted Units pool capacity: +4 for Nurglings units
Gifted Units pool capacity: +2 for Plaguebearers units

technology.name: Rotten Relics
technology.description: Symbols of sickness are but a source of strength to the mortals seeking the Plague Lord's embrace.

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: +10% for each active Gift of Nurgle
	(all armies)
Path to Glory: -25% Souls cost to devote to Nurgle

technology.name: Daemon Mounts
technology.description: Daemonic steeds are driven by unnatural hunger, carrying mortals sworn to Chaos into battle in search of prey.

effects.description: Unlocks Warband upgrades: Gorebeast Chariots, Doom Knights and Skullcrushers
Unit experience gain: +25% for Chaos Knights

technology.name: Prayers of Sickness
technology.description: Through fervent prayer to the Urfather, His mortal followers are reborn as children of pox and pestilence.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Slime Trail" for Aspiring Champions and Chosen of Nurgle units
Vigour loss reduction: -25% for Chosen of Nurgle and Chaos Warriors of Nurgle units

technology.name: Rite of Ascension
technology.description: The dark rites must be performed, if the chosen are to rise among the ranks of Ruin.

effects.description: Unlocks Warband upgrades: Chosen
Unit experience gain: +25% for Chaos Warriors

technology.name: Profane Weaponry
technology.description: The arms of a Chaos Knight are imbued with a small but not inconsequential amount of Unholy power.

effects.description: Unlocks Warband upgrades: Chaos Knights
Enables magical attacks for Chaos Knights units

technology.name: Inscribed Chaos Armour
technology.description: Chaos Armour, inscribed with powerful litanies of hate, will glow hot and vengeful when struck.

effects.description: Warband upgrades cost: -20% for all units
Armour: +10 for Chaos Warriors, Chosen, Chaos Knights and Aspiring Champion units

technology.name: Dark Diplomacy
technology.description: All the forces of Chaos must unite, if the scourge of Order is to ever be undone.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +25% for alliances and vassalage with Skaven, Beastmen and Norsca
Diplomatic relations: +15 with Skaven, Norsca and Beastmen for each active Gift of Chaos Undivided

technology.name: Unchained Beasts
technology.description: A worthy Beastmaster needs no chains to direct the ferocious nature of his darling pets.

effects.description: Melee attack: +8 for Chaos Warhounds and Feral Manticore units
Passive ability: "Gorefeast" for Chaos Warhounds and Feral Manticore units (Rank 4 and above)

technology.name: Rusted Branding Iron
technology.description: Nurgle's mark reeks of rot and decay, encapsulating the source of His power.

effects.description: Warband upgrades: Allows Undivided units to receive the Mark of Nurgle
Enables poison attacks for Aspiring Champions

technology.name: Rotten Altar
technology.description: Nurgle's presence can be felt at the altar of sacrifice, inspiring the hearts of His adoring followers.

effects.description: Nurgle Authority: +1 for each active Gift of Nurgle

technology.name: Scrutiny of the Dark Gods
technology.description: Let the Marauders gather under their Dark Masters' eternal gaze.

effects.description: Unit experience gain: +25% for Marauders

technology.name: Charioteer
technology.description: Engineers have perfected a wicked machine of war, drawn by fearsome steeds into the very heart of battle.

effects.description: Unlocks Warband upgrades: Chaos Chariots and Hellstriders
Unit experience gain: +25% for Marauder Horsemen

technology.name: Daemonic Pact
technology.description: A pact with the Dark Gods should not be taken lightly.

effects.description: Maximum active gifts: +1 for Gifts of Chaos Undivided
Army ability: "Chaotic Torment" when attacking
Attribute: Cause Fear for Aspiring Champions and Undivided Chosen units
All Authority: +1

technology.name: Giant Manacles
technology.description: Such massive iron bands are a marvel to behold, lending strength to the swing of the most colossal creatures.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% for Chaos Trolls and Chaos Giant units
Missile resistance: 25% for Chaos Trolls and Chaos Giant units (Rank 4 and above)

technology.name: Gaze of the Dark Gods
technology.description: All hope to catch the attention of the Gods, gathering where they think the Ruinous Powers will be looking.

effects.description: Maximum active gifts: +1 for Gifts of Chaos Undivided
Army ability: "Forsaken Blessing" when attacking
Attribute: Perfect Vigour for Aspiring Champions and Undivided Chosen units
All Authority: +1

technology.name: Doctor of Death
technology.description: The Dark Apothecary revels in madness, mixing various concoctions to prepare him for Nurgle's blessings.

effects.description: Maximum active gifts: +1 for Gifts of Nurgle
Ability: "Locus of Fecundity" for Aspiring Champions units

technology.name: Blasphemous Summons
technology.description: Emboldened by the Leechlord's success, the Daemons of Nurgle eagerly gather to play their part.

effects.description: Plague duration: +3 turns
Gifted Units pool capacity: +2 for Great Unclean One units
Path to Glory: -25% Souls cost to upgrade characters to a Daemon Prince of Nurgle

technology.name: Infernal March
technology.description: The Chaos Gods grow impatient. Lending a sliver of majesty, they enable their followers to march faster.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5% for armies
Battle reinforcement time: -50%

technology.name: Erection of Ruinous Monuments
technology.description: Tributes and monuments to the Dark Powers ensure the Chaos Gods' favour.

effects.description: Unlocks Hero recruitment and post-battle loot bonus effects for Altar Improvement buildings
Construction time: -20% for all buildings

technology.name: A Thousand Twisted Blessings
technology.description: Such a generous gift is the thousand twisted blessings. Think of all the needle-teeth and tentacles it bestows.

effects.description: Unlocks Warband upgrades: Forsaken
Attribute: Cause Terror for Chaos Spawn units
Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Spawn units

technology.name: Malignant Totems
technology.description: Unholy tributes and towering monuments ensure the Chaos Gods' favour.

effects.description: Lord recruit rank: +3
Chaos corruption: +2 for each active Gift of Chaos Undivided

technology.name: Culling of the Weak
technology.description: Stragglers will not be entertained. If you can't keep the pace, you are food for the Warhounds.

effects.description: Souls gained from battles: +20%

technology.name: Swamp of Souls
technology.description: Corruption festers like a deadly contagion, with its price paid in a deluge of souls.

effects.description: Nurgle corruption: +2 from Chaos Altars
Nurgle corruption: +1 for each active Gift of Nurgle

technology.name: Slaves to Darkness
technology.description: Perhaps the threat of a collar and chain would remind these lesser beings of their place.

effects.description: Request army cost: -25%
War co-ordination target cost: -25%

technology.name: Experimental Diseases
technology.description: The Leechlord experiments night and day, perfecting the most putrid of plagues.

effects.description: Grants line of sight when a plague is spread

technology.name: Rancid Structures
technology.description: In the domain of Nurgle, every building serves as a festering hub of disease.

effects.description: Unlocks bonus Growth effect for Dark Fortress military buildings

technology.name: Maddening Gifts
technology.description: Nurgle bestows blessings in the form of rampant disease and the endless process of decay.

effects.description: Maximum active gifts: +1 for Gifts of Nurgle
Army ability: "Fecundity"

ui_effects.description: Will spread to friends within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

technology.name: Messenger of Decay
technology.description: Every soul sent the Urfather's way is a victory celebrated by every one of His warriors.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +25% for alliances and vassalage with Nurgle
Diplomatic relations: +15 with Nurglish factions for each active Gift of Nurgle

technology.name: Powerful Patients
technology.description: Old Sawbones welcomes those marked by the Urfather.

effects.description: Path to Glory: +50% levels kept when devoting a character to Nurgle
Hero capacity: +2 for Exalted Heroes
Enables direct recruitment of Marked Exalted Heroes
